context: Yale's central campus in downtown New Haven covers 260 acres (1.1 km2) and comprises its main, historic campus and a medical campus adjacent to the Yale-New Haven Hospital. In <a0_0><b5_0>western New Haven<b5_0/><a0_0/>, the university holds 500 acres (2.0 km2) of athletic facilities, including the Yale Golf Course. In 2008, Yale purchased the 136-acre (0.55 km2) <a1_0><b6_0>former Bayer Pharmaceutical campus<b6_0/><a1_0/> in West Haven, Connecticut, the buildings of which are now used as <a2_0><b7_0>laboratory and research space<b7_0/><a2_0/>. Yale also owns <a3_0><b8_0>seven<b8_0/><a3_0/> forests in Connecticut, Vermont, and New Hampshire—the largest of which is the <a4_0><b9_0>7,840-acre<b9_0/><a4_0/> (31.7 km2) Yale-Myers Forest in Connecticut's Quiet Corner—and nature preserves including Horse Island.
